title: React custom rendering: react-blessed
body:
Hello React team. With the release of `0.14.0-beta1` and the separation of the rendering logic from React's core, I started scaffolding a custom renderer for the [blessed](https://github.com/chjj/blessed) library, used to create terminal interfaces. [Here](https://github.com/Yomguithereal/react-blessed) is therefore the WIP but nonetheless working version of `react-blessed`.

This issue is therefore a way for me to give you some feedback on the creation of custom renderers, to ask you for some advice and to check whether I did things correctly and in a way you would deem to be the right one.

Here are the steps I followed:
- I created a `ReactBlessedComponent` and `ReactBlessedTextComponent` based respectively upon `ReactDOMComponent` and `ReactDOMTextComponent`.
- I creared a `ReactBlessedReconcileTransaction` mimicking the behavior of `ReactReconcileTransaction`.
- I created an injection file that basically does the following:

``` js
ReactInjection.NativeComponent.injectGenericComponentClass(
  ReactBlessedComponent
);

ReactInjection.NativeComponent.injectTextComponentClass(
  ReactBlessedTextComponent
);

ReactInjection.Updates.injectReconcileTransaction(
  ReactBlessedReconcileTransaction
);
```
- I created an endpoint for the renderer exposing a simple function taking a React valid element and a blessed `screen` options based on what `ReactServerRendering` would do.
- I had to override `ReactComponentEnvironment.processChildrenUpdates` and set it to a noop so my updates can work without the DOM.

So now I have a working renderer with working state, reconciliation, refs, events etc.

Is there things I would have missed and that would break the renderer at some point?
